level.heading: Credit Life, Accident, and Health Insurance

placeholder.heading: Choice of companies to provide required coverage.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 13-265
level.text: For D.C. Law 13-265, see notes following § 31-2231.01.

placeholder.heading: Insurance plans and programs submitted pursuant to § 42-836.01(2)(B).

level.heading: Temporary Amendment of Section
level.text: For temporary (225 day) amendment of section, see § 2 of Protections from Predatory Lending and Mortgage Foreclosure Improvements Temporary Amendment Act of 2001 (D.C. Law 14-86, March 19, 2002, law notification 49 DCR 2991).

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: Section 2 of Act 14-188, the "Protections from Predatory Lending and Mortgage Foreclosure Improvements Emergency Amendment Act", deemed approved Nov. 27, 2001, without the signature of the Mayor, provided that D.C. Law 13-263 shall not apply beginning November 6, 2001, through March 6, 2002.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 13-263
level.text: For D.C. Law 13-263, see notes following § 31-5101.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 14-132
level.text: Law 14-132, the "Home Loan Protection Act of 2002", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 14-515, which was referred to the Committee on Consumer and Regulatory Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on February 5, 2002, and February 19, 2002, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on March 1, 2002, it was assigned Act No. 14-296 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 14-132 became effective on May 7, 2002.

level.heading: Effective Dates
level.text: Section 602(a) of Law 14-132 provided: "The Protections from Predatory Lending and Mortgage Foreclosure Improvements Act of 2000, effective April 3, 2001 (D.C. Law 13-263; 48 DCR 991), is repealed as of November 6, 2001."
